metadata.title: CVE-2020-16042 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Uninitialized Use in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 87.0.4280.88 allowed aremote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from processmemory via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16042` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
